result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $1646.00 entered as ordered by the court on 07/05/2016to pay $25.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 03/01/2022. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
(of) Attorney Fees and Costs.  Signed, scanned and filed, sdg.

Defendant Ernesto Castillo Rivas in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed with prejudice.  Bail to be returned if applicable.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Ernesto Castillo Rivas in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant has completed the full TWENTY (20) HOURS of Community Service AND the letter of apology.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

Defendant Ernesto Castillo Rivas in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 On state's oral  motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wis. Stats. sec. 947.01, a Class B Misdemeanor.  Review hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ernesto Castillo Rivas in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alyssa M. Schaller with student appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Fokus Family Service progress report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Ernesto Castillo Rivas in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is approved for FOKUS Family, and awaiting TAD assessment.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
From Fokus Family Services.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Ernesto Castillo Rivas in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
 Indigency hearing proceeded.    Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints 
 Christopher Ertl as counsel for defendant.   Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the conclusion of this case.
Oral No Contact Order with Pick 'N Save store at 4698 S. Whitnall Avenue, in the City of Saint Francis, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.

Defendant Ernesto Castillo Rivas in court.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (02-21-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
